Question: This person was elected President as the unanimous choice of the 69 electors in 1788, and he served two terms in office.
Hints: At his death, this person was eulogized as "first in war, first in peace, and first in the hearts of his countrymen" by Henry Lee.
This person suffered from problems with his teeth throughout his life.
Nominated by John Adams of Massachusetts, this person was then appointed General and Commander-in-chief.
